1. Local raw materials: 1a) Low use-lives, with knapping strategies characterised by manufacture, use and discard
2. Non-local raw materials: 2a) Majority of formal tools, in the case of individual provisioning or higher use-lives, with knapping strategies characterised by the manufacture, use and maintenance

1. Local raw materials: 1b) Decreased reduction intensity and low tools to debitage ratio
2. Non-local raw materials: 2b) Increased reduction intensity and high tools to debitage ratio

1. Local raw materials: 1c) Larger cores and lower blank-to-core ratio
2. Non-local raw materials: 2c) Smaller cores and higher blank-to-core ratio

1. Local raw materials: 1d) Less extensive reduction and reworking of tools
2. Non-local raw materials: 2d) More extensive reduction and high presence of retouch and/or tool maintenance
2e) Lower tool diversity, characterised by less specialised tool
